newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian forces kill 13 separatists in Kashmir.
newsitem.headline: Indian forces kill 13 separatists in Kashmir.

text.p: At least 13 separatist guerrillas were killed on Saturday in a gunbattle with Indian security forces in Jammu and Kashmir state near the Pakistan border, a defence spokesman said.
"Thirteen militants were killed near the border when the militants infiltrated from Pakistan through Kaubal Gali in Kupwara district," Colonel Sunil Kapoor told Reuters.
Kupwara lies on the Indian-Pakistan frontier 75 kms (47 miles) north of Srinagar, summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir.

"A group of heavily armed militants were challenged by the soldiers when they crossed to this side of border. The militants opened fire which resulted in a fierce encounter and 13 militants were killed," Kapoor said. "The operation is still going on."
India controls two-thirds of Kashmir and Pakistan the rest.
More than a dozen guerrilla groups have fought a rebellion in Indian-administered Kashmir since 1990. Some demand an independent homeland while others want a merger with Pakistan.
